title: Valid concretization requiring older version is not found in dependency resolution
body:
Due a pinned version on the libzqm dependency of cppzmq, but an open version libzqm dependency in py-pyzmq, a bundle package that depends on both cppzmq and py-pyzmq results in an unsatisfiable version constraint even though a satisfiable version can be hinted at (and, arguably, should have been found). This may point to a class of unsatisfiable version constraints elsewhere that can be resolved.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack create -t bundle -n zmqbug
```
Add a version and two generic dependencies:
```python
    version('1.0.0')
    depends_on('cppzmq')
    depends_on('py-pyzmq')
```
```console
$ spack spec zmqbug
$ spack spec zmqbug ^libzmq@4.2.5
```

### Error Message

The first spec (no hinting) fails with:
```console
$ spack spec zmqbug
Input spec
--------------------------------
zmqbug

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Error: An unsatisfiable version constraint has been detected for spec:

    libzmq@4.3.2%gcc@9.3.0+libsodium arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-ivybridge


while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    cppzmq@4.3.0%gcc@9.3.0 build_type=RelWithDebInfo arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-ivybridge
        ^cmake@3.13.4%gcc@9.3.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-ubuntu20.04-ivybridge


cppzmq requires libzmq version 4.2.5, but spec asked for 4.3.2
```

### Additional information

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

Note: In order to work around this issue, I am simultaneously filing a PR #18087 to remove the version pinning on cppzmq by adding a more recent version.
